title: Saka
summary: The Saka, Śaka, Shaka,  Śāka or Sacae (Old Persian: 𐎿𐎣𐎠 Sakā; Kharosthi: 𐨯𐨐 Saka; Brahmi:  , Śaka; Sanskrit: शक Śaka, शाक Śāka; Ancient Greek: Σάκαι Sákai; Latin: Sacae; Chinese: 塞, old *Sək, mod. Sè, Sāi; Ancient Egyptian: 𓋴𓎝𓎡𓈉 sk, 𓐠𓎼𓈉 sꜣg) were a group of nomadic Iranian peoples who historically inhabited the northern and eastern Eurasian Steppe and the Tarim Basin.[2][3]
